alert.note: Alert for Surry (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 12:36PM EST until January 09 at 7:15PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northwest North Carolina, including the following counties, in north central North Carolina, Stokes and Surry. In northwest North Carolina, Alleghany NC and Yadkin. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1234 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Beaver Creek, Beaverdam Creek, Arnold Branch, Ararat River and Archies Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches with isolated higher amounts are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Airy, Elkin, Fairview, Flat Rock, Yadkinville, Jonesville and Dobson. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
